name: Ginger Scones
author: Kim
summary: A light and buttery scone with a good hit of ginger flavor.
ingredients: ½ cup finely chopped crystallized ginger
3 tablespoons coarse sugar, or as needed  (Optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Whisk flour, sugar, ginger, cardamom, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together until thoroughly combined
Grate in frozen butter using a box grater
Toss until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
Whisk buttermilk, egg, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl or measuring cup until thoroughly combined
Add to dry ingredients and mix just until no dry clumps of flour remain; dough will be somewhat sticky
Turn dough out onto the prepared baking sheet
Gently press dough together into an even 7-inch circle
Lightly flour your hands if dough is too sticky to shape
Cut dough into 8 triangles using a bench scraper
Space scones 1 inch apart on the baking sheet
Whisk egg and water until combined
Gently brush the top of each scone with the egg wash
Bake in the preheated oven until scones are lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes
Cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring scones to a wire rack to cool completely
